“clean filter” alert came on after 5 minutes of use the very first time. I returned to Best Buy and exchanged it immediately but guess what?? The second vacuum did the same thing. I then read online that this is a common problem and dyson knows about it. Apparently, there are just some “bad batches” out there with “faulty sensors”

The auto-adjust system is excellent and adds time since we have 80% hard floors.

This vacuum is a bit too heavy. The top section, where the motor and battery are, weighs 4 lbs. 8 oz. That’s quite a bit of weight on top. After a few minutes, you’ll find yourself needing to use two hands to move the vacuum around. The other drawback to having so much weight on top is that it throws the balance off. People are used to the weight on the bottom nozzle where the suction happens and when it’s the opposite it introduces usability issues such as having to make sure you keep the floor nozzle grounded as you’re prone to lifting it up due to the unnatural weight distribution.
The airway blocks every time it’s used despite being emptied every time

Amazing battery life. I love my Tineco cordless vacuum. It has a powerful suction and when I need a little extra suction the Max suction button comes in handy. It comes with 2 batteries and most of the time I’m able to vacuum my entire house (1,400 sqf) rug and hardwood floors on just one battery which is amazing!
